page.title: 19PEAK RAILWAY
page.content: The old Peak Railway from Buxton to Matlock station used to carry passengers and goods but{it was closed {down in 1963.}The railway builders tried to keep the track as straight and flat as possible.The road and railway in the valley run alongside the river Wye. To build the railway, millions of tonnes of stone had to be moved by men using spades,picks and wheelbarrows. The stones were removed from the hills and were used to fill the hollows. Along the track there are two {tunnels}and {eight bridges. {Peak Rail Preservation Society are {trying to re-open the railway.}They have already started to work on it At the moment, part of the track-bed is used as a footpath :the{MONSAL {TRAIL.
